intro: Phyllanthus breynioides, commonly known as the African spurge, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers and succulent leaves. The plant is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. It has a compact growth habit and is sometimes cultivated as an ornamental plant. Its botanical features make it well-suited for xeriscaping and low-maintenance gardens.
